Craving has two kinds:
Craving one's own body and craving what is needed.

Not yet obtaining the five desires, the mind is focused on seeking;

There are also three kinds:
Craving for desire, craving for form, and craving for the formless.
There are also three kinds:
Craving caused by karma, craving caused by afflictions, and craving caused by suffering.
Those who have left the household life have four kinds of craving.
What are the four?
Clothing, food and drink, bedding, and medicine.
There are also five kinds:
Attachment to the five aggregates, following all needs and desires, and discriminating and conceptualizing to an immeasurable and limitless extent.

There are two kinds of craving:
First, wholesome craving; second, unwholesome craving.
Unwholesome craving is the seeking of the foolish;
Wholesome Dharma craving is the seeking of the bodhisattvas.
Wholesome Dharma craving is also of two kinds:
Unwholesome and wholesome.
Seeking the two vehicles is called unwholesome;
Seeking the Great Vehicle is called wholesome.

The craving of ordinary beings is called the origin [of suffering], not the truth;
The craving of bodhisattvas is called the true truth, not the origin [of suffering].
Why is this?
In order to liberate sentient beings, they take rebirth, not out of craving.
Bodhisattva MahÄkÄÅ›yapa addressed the Buddha, saying:

Just as the World-Honored Buddha has explained in other sutras that for sentient beings, karma is the cause and condition, or he has explained that pride, or the six sense contacts, or ignorance are the causes and conditions for the five aggregates.

It is like when a great king goes out on a tour of inspection, his ministers and retinue all follow him;
craving is also like this. Wherever craving goes, all the bonds and so forth also follow.
It is like a greasy garment, wherever dust adheres, it sticks;

It is like a poor person who owes another person money and goods. Although they have repaid most of it, because there is still a remainder, they are still kept in prison and cannot be released.

What is it like to be entangled by a poisonous snake on a beautiful flower stem?
It is like a person who loves beautiful flowers but does not see the danger of a poisonous snake on the flower stem. He then goes to pick it, and when he does, he is bitten by the snake and dies.

All ordinary beings are also like this. They crave the flowers of the five desires and do not see the danger of the poisonous snake of craving. They then accept it and are bitten by the snake of craving. When their lives end, they fall into the three evil destinies;
Only bodhisattvas are an exception.
This is called being entangled by a poisonous snake on a beautiful flower stem.

What is meant by eating what is indigestible?
It is like a person who eats what is indigestible. After eating, he suffers from stomach pain, diarrhea, and death.
Craving is like this. Sentient beings in the five destinies forcefully eat and become attached to it. Because of this cause and condition, they fall into the three evil destinies;
Only bodhisattvas are an exception.
This is called eating what is indigestible.
Good man!
What is meant by being like a prostitute?
It is like a foolish person who has intercourse with a prostitute. The prostitute skillfully acts in various flattering ways to appear intimate, and takes away all the person's money and possessions;
when the money and possessions are exhausted, she then drives him away.

The prostitute of desire is also like this. A foolish person lacks wisdom and has intercourse with her. This prostitute of desire takes away all the person's wholesome dharmas. When the wholesome dharmas are exhausted, she drives him away and causes him to fall into the three evil destinies;

This is called a prostitute.
Good son!
What is meant by being like a silk-cotton tree seed?

It is like a silk-cotton tree seed. If a bird eats it and the seed falls to the ground with the feces, or if it is blown by the wind to under a tree, it will then grow and wrap around and bind the silk-cotton tree, causing it to not grow and eventually wither and die.

The seeds of the love vine are also like this. They entangle and bind the good dharmas of ordinary beings, preventing them from growing and eventually causing them to wither. After withering, upon the end of life, they fall into the three evil destinies;
Only excluding bodhisattvas.
This is called like the seeds of the love vine.

What is like a polyp in a wound?
It is like a person who has a polyp grow in an old wound. That person must diligently treat it and not give rise to a mind of abandonment.
If they give rise to a mind of abandonment, the polyp will grow and maggots will form again. Due to this cause and condition, they will then die.
The five aggregates of an ordinary foolish person are also like this. Love is like a polyp in the middle. One should diligently treat the polyp of love.
If one does not treat it, upon the end of life, they will fall into the three evil destinies;
Only excluding bodhisattvas.
This is called like a polyp in a wound.
Good son!

The comet of craving is also like this. It can cut off all the seeds of wholesome roots, causing ordinary people to be orphaned, impoverished, famished, give rise to the sickness of afflictions, transmigrate in birth and death, and experience various sufferings;
Only bodhisattvas are excluded.

Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas abiding in the MahÄyÄna MahÄparinirvÄá¹‡a contemplate the bonds of craving in these nine ways.

For this reason, ordinary beings have suffering but not the truth of suffering.
